S:
## Task ##
You are a navigational agent in a 2D 12x12 grid world filled with specific obstacles and limited by boundaries.
Your objective is to navigate to (11, 11).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (1, 4).
The grid has obstacles located at [(2, 0), (2, 1), (3, 4), (3, 5), (4, 0), (4, 3), (4, 7), (4, 10), (5, 10), (6, 1), (6, 3), (6, 8), (6, 9), (6, 11), (7, 0), (7, 1), (7, 5), (7, 8), (7, 9), (8, 4), (8, 5), (8, 8), (9, 10), (10, 4), (10, 10), (11, 6), (11, 8)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 13 OR c > 13.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

## Move commands ##
You can move in four directions:
"up" decreases r by one
"down" increases r by one
"left" decreases c by one
"right" increases c by one

## Objective ##
Given current position (r, c), navigate to (11, 11) using move commands.
Avoid collisions with obstacles and boundaries of the grid.

## Output Format ##
Generate JSON response to the prompt in following format:
{
    "explanation": "",
    "move": "up/down/left/right"
}
A: {"explanation": "From (1, 4), moving 'down' to (2, 4) is safe and reduces the vertical distance to the goal.", "move": "down"}

## Task ##
You are a navigational agent in a 2D 12x12 grid world filled with specific obstacles and limited by boundaries.
Your objective is to navigate to (11, 11).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (1, 4).
The grid has obstacles located at [(2, 0), (2, 1), (3, 4), (3, 5), (4, 0), (4, 3), (4, 7), (4, 10), (5, 10), (6, 1), (6, 3), (6, 8), (6, 9), (6, 11), (7, 0), (7, 1), (7, 5), (7, 8), (7, 9), (8, 4), (8, 5), (8, 8), (9, 10), (10, 4), (10, 10), (11, 6), (11, 8)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 13 OR c > 13.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

## Move commands ##
You can move in four directions:
"up" decreases r by one
"down" increases r by one
"left" decreases c by one
"right" increases c by one

## Objective ##
Given current position (r, c), navigate to (11, 11) using move commands.
Avoid collisions with obstacles and boundaries of the grid.

## Output Format ##
Generate JSON response to the prompt in following format:
{
    "explanation": "",
    "move": "up/down/left/right"
}
A:
{"explanation": "Let's analyze each possible move from (6, 7):

1. Move 'up': New position will be (5, 7). This position is not an obstacle and within grid boundaries. Distance to goal (11, 11) will be √((11-5)² + (11-7)²) ≈ 7.21.
2. Move 'down': New position will be (7, 7). This position is not an obstacle and within grid boundaries. Distance to goal (11, 11) will be √((11-7)² + (11-7)²) ≈ 5.66.
3. Move 'left': New position will be (6, 6). This position is not an obstacle and within grid boundaries. Distance to goal (11, 11) will be √((11-6)² + (11-6)²) ≈ 7.07.
4. Move 'right': New position will be (6, 8). This position is an obstacle, so this move is not safe.

Among the safe moves, moving 'down' to (7, 7) seems to be the best option as it reduces the distance to the goal the most.", "move": "down"}

## Task ##
You are a navigational agent in a 2D 12x12 grid world filled with specific obstacles and limited by boundaries.
Your objective is to navigate to (11, 11).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (1, 4).
The grid has obstacles located at [(2, 0), (2, 1), (3, 4), (3, 5), (4, 0), (4, 3), (4, 7), (4, 10), (5, 10), (6, 1), (6, 3), (6, 8), (6, 9), (6, 11), (7, 0), (7, 1), (7, 5), (7, 8), (7, 9), (8, 4), (8, 5), (8, 8), (9, 10), (10, 4), (10, 10), (11, 6), (11, 8)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 13 OR c > 13.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

## Move commands ##
You can move in four directions:
"up" decreases r by one
"down" increases r by one
"left" decreases c by one
"right" increases c by one

## Objective ##
Given current position (r, c), navigate to (11, 11) using move commands.
Avoid collisions with obstacles and boundaries of the grid.

## Output Format ##
Generate JSON response to the prompt in following format:
{
    "explanation": "",
    "move": "up/down/left/right"
}
A: {"explanation": "From position (7, 7), moving 'up' to (6, 7) avoids obstacles and is within the grid boundaries. Moving 'down' to (8, 7) avoids obstacles and is within the grid boundaries. Moving 'left' to (7, 6) avoids obstacles and is within the grid boundaries. Moving 'right' to (7, 8) leads to an obstacle. The safest move with the shortest path to the goal is 'down'.", "move": "down"}
